bibl.title: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, October 14, 1924

div1.p: Rosenau thanks Carter for sending him the historical chapter of his book on yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from M.J. Rosenau to Henry Rose Carter, October 14, 1924
div1.opener:
Book
Rosenau
HARVARD UNIVERSITY
MEDICAL SCHOOL
DEPARTMENT OF PREVENTIVE MEDICINE AND HYGIENE
Boston, Massachusetts.
October 14, 1924.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
The Westmoreland,
2122 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
Yesterday was a holiday and I find your
letter of October 8th on my desk this morning. I am delight-
ed to know that you are sending me the manuscript of the
historical chapter of your book, for be it known that I had
already written to Russell asking him for a copy, not know-
ing that it was not ready for manifolding and distribution.

My wife joins me in very kindest regards
to you and Laura. I will have to cut this letter short, for
Dr. Madsen, of Copenhagen, is with me and there is the usual
post-holiday jam.
